Ask HN: Nuclear plants in war zones: A valid reason not to build more
text:
The media has frequently been screaming about the dangers of one of the nuclear powerplants in Ukraine being targeted and damaged in the war.

A dirty nuke, radiation over Europe the scenarios being discussed are plentiful.

To me this seems to be the best argument to not invest and rely on nuclear powerplants going forward.

Ukraine has several other types of power generators / plants that are not featured much in the media. The exception being hydropower when a dam was damaged.

The argument “There will never be a war here” seems foolish to me.

title: Ask HN: What Ever Happened to Agile?
text:
Second workplace in 2 years that advertises itself as agile.

Yet here's how they do it. Minimum CI. No CD. Features that are designed through a long waterfall stage in the beginning of a quarter (how the heck can you design something to its entirety bfr even touching code I really don't know). Long QA stage with lots of manual testing in it.

In short, that's as far from agile in my mind as it could get.

And let's not even touch DevOps (down in flames AFAIK- btw there was a HN post a while ago on that. If you have it handy pls post a link here).

Am I unlucky? Is the job market I'm in stuck in 90s? (Fringe EU low salary market). Is agile dead(ish)? What is going on?

Ask HN: Who bought an acceptable Geiger counter on Aliexpress?
text: I am interested to own a Geiger counter since I have been to Chernobyl 10 years ago. I know it's 99% a gimmick. Anyway, some years ago the detector of ionising radiation + Gamma Spectrometer from RadiaScan was featured on HN, and I have been having an eye on it since then. The price is still a little too high for me. Therefore I went to Aliexpress today and was surprised to find a plethora of Geiger Counters. Now, has anyone tried them with a proper test setup? I would assume that there are many scammers making a quick buck with the current fear of nuclear war. Or did they just start to copy the technology of Radiascan?
